action.action-desc: Mr. Smucker (for himself and Ms. Van Duyne) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend part A of title IV of the Social Security Act to allow States to transfer a limited amount of funds provided under the program of block grants to States for temporary assistance for needy families, for use under title I of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Reduce Duplication and Improve Access to Work Act.

section.header: Allowing transfers to support workforce development

subsection.text: Section 404(d) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 604(d)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: Title I of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act.
in the heading, by striking subtitle 1 and inserting subtitle a ; and
in subparagraph (A), by striking subtitle 1 and inserting subtitle A; and

clause.text: in the heading, by striking 1 of title xx and inserting a of title xx and title i of WIOA; and
by striking 1 of title XX and inserting A of title XX or title I of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act; and

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Funds transferred to title I of WIOA program

clause.text: In the case of funds transferred under paragraph (1)(C) of this subsection, not more than 15 percent of the funds shall be reserved for statewide workforce investment activities referred to in section 128(a)(1) of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act.

clause.header: Submission of combined State plan under WIOA
clause.text: If a State intends to transfer funds under paragraph (1)(C) of this subsection, the State shall—

subclause.text: submit to the Secretary and the Secretary of Labor a combined State plan pursuant to section 103 of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act that covers the State program to be carried out pursuant to this part; and
in doing so, apply section 102(c)(3) of such Act to the programs referred to in section 103(a)(2)(B) of such Act covered by the combined plan.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall take effect on October 1, 2026.
